p: Contrasting the decline in the Trifolium species, brambles ( Rubus spp.) have seen an increase in forage use compared to 1952 and are now the most foraged genus for honeybees in the UK. In 1952, Rubus was the major taxa in only 5% of honey samples, compared to 31% in 2017 ( x 2 = 367.07, d.f = 1, P < 0.001), supported by the Countryside Survey which recorded an increase in the most widely distributed and common species Rubus fruticosus by 21% between 1978 and 2007.
